actor_awards.notes: Won the Academy Award for Best Supporting Actor for his role as Bela Lugosi in Ed Wood. He received Golden Globes for Ed Wood, Tucker: The Man and His Dream, and the TV series Mission: Impossible. He was also a respected acting teacher at the Actors Studio.

filmography.title: Ed Wood
filmography.role_description: The aging, drug-addicted horror film legend who forms a poignant friendship with the aspiring director Ed Wood.
filmography.plot: Ambitious but troubled movie director Edward D. Wood Jr. tries his best to fulfill his dreams, despite his lack of talent.

filmography.title: North by Northwest
filmography.role_description: The sinister and fiercely loyal right-hand man to the villainous Phillip Vandamm.
filmography.plot: A New York City advertising executive is mistaken for a government agent by a group of foreign spies and is pursued across the country.

filmography.title: Crimes and Misdemeanors
filmography.role_description: A successful ophthalmologist and family man who resorts to murder to cover up an affair, grappling with the moral consequences.
filmography.plot: An ophthalmologist's mistress threatens to reveal their affair to his wife, while a married documentary filmmaker is infatuated with another woman.

filmography.title: Tucker: The Man and His Dream
filmography.role_description: The pragmatic New York financier and business partner who helps Preston Tucker navigate the automotive industry.
filmography.plot: The story of Preston Tucker, the maverick car designer and his ill-fated challenge to the auto industry with his revolutionary car concept.

filmography.title: Cleopatra
filmography.role_description: The loyal general and aide to Julius Caesar and later Mark Antony during the Roman civil wars.
filmography.plot: Queen Cleopatra VII of Egypt experiences both triumph and tragedy in her attempts to resist the imperial ambitions of Rome.

filmography.title: Rounders
filmography.role_description: A law professor and mentor who sees potential in his student, despite the student's gambling habits.
filmography.plot: A young reformed gambler must return to playing big stakes poker to help a friend pay off loan sharks.

filmography.title: The Majestic
filmography.role_description: The elderly owner of a movie palace in a small town who mistakes an amnesiac writer for his son lost in the war.
filmography.plot: In 1951, a blacklisted Hollywood writer gets into a car accident, loses his memory, and settles in a small town where he is mistaken for a long-lost son.

filmography.title: Sleepy Hollow
filmography.role_description: A wealthy landowner who becomes an early victim of the Headless Horseman (uncredited but notable).
filmography.plot: Ichabod Crane is sent to Sleepy Hollow to investigate the decapitations of three people, with the culprit being the legendary apparition, the Headless Horseman.

filmography.title: Remember
filmography.role_description: An Auschwitz survivor residing in a nursing home who helps his friend track down the Nazi guard who killed their families.
filmography.plot: With the aid of a fellow Auschwitz survivor and a hand-written letter, an elderly man with dementia goes in search of the person responsible for the death of his family.
filmography.awards: Canadian Screen Award: Nomination – Best Actor

filmography.title: Frankenweenie
filmography.role_description: The eccentric and inspiring science teacher whose lessons on lightning influence the protagonist.
filmography.plot: A boy brings his dead dog back to life with science, but his secret leaks out and terrorizes the neighbors.

filmography.role_description: The voice of the kindly, inventive elder rag doll who is the first to befriend the protagonist.
filmography.plot: A rag doll that wakes up in a post-apocalyptic future holds the key to humanity's salvation.

filmography.title: Pork Chop Hill
filmography.role_description: A lieutenant in this gritty Korean War drama, marking one of Landau's earliest film roles.
filmography.plot: While peace negotiations are going on, a US Army company must attempt to recapture a hill from the Chinese.

filmography.title: Nevada Smith
filmography.role_description: One of the three outlaws hunted by Steve McQueen's character, known for his skill with a knife.
filmography.plot: A mixed-race cowboy sets out to avenge the brutal murder of his parents by three outlaws.

filmography.title: The Greatest Story Ever Told
filmography.role_description: The Jewish high priest who plays a central role in the trial of Jesus.
filmography.plot: An all-star epic retelling of the life of Jesus Christ, from the Nativity to the Resurrection.

filmography.title: The X Files
filmography.role_description: A paranoid author and old friend of Mulder's father who provides key information about the alien conspiracy.
filmography.plot: Mulder and Scully must fight the government in a conspiracy and find the truth about an alien colonization of Earth.

filmography.title: Lovely, Still
filmography.role_description: A lonely, elderly grocery bagger who finds love for the first time with a mysterious woman.
filmography.plot: A holiday fable that tells the story of an elderly man discovering love for the first time.

filmography.title: Alone in the Dark
filmography.role_description: A charismatic but psychotic former preacher who escapes from a mental institution.
filmography.plot: A quartet of murderous psychopaths escape from a mental hospital during a blackout and besiege their doctor's house.

filmography.title: City Hall
filmography.role_description: A seasoned and influential New York City judge involved in the political maneuverings.
filmography.plot: A young deputy mayor investigates a shooting that threatens to expose corruption within the city government.

filmography.title: They Call Me Mister Tibbs!
filmography.role_description: A liberal preacher and politician suspected of murder, whom Virgil Tibbs must investigate.
filmography.plot: San Francisco police lieutenant Virgil Tibbs investigates a murder where the prime suspect is a liberal street preacher and political candidate.

filmography.title: Pinocchio
filmography.role_description: The lonely woodcarver who creates the puppet Pinocchio.
filmography.plot: A live-action adaptation of the classic tale of a puppet who wants to become a real boy.

filmography.title: The Hallelujah Trail
filmography.role_description: A comedic role as a Native American chief attempting to intercept a wagon train of whiskey.
filmography.plot: A wagon train heading for Denver with a cargo of whiskey is targeted by temperance campaigners, the US Cavalry, and local Indians.

filmography.title: The Gazebo
filmography.role_description: A member of a criminal gang who harasses the protagonist.
filmography.plot: A TV writer plots the perfect crime to get rid of a blackmailer, burying the body under his new backyard gazebo.

filmography.title: Intersection
filmography.role_description: The business partner of the main character, played by Richard Gere.
filmography.plot: As his car hurtles toward a collision, an architect flashes back through the events of his life and his loves.

filmography.title: Abe & Phil's Last Poker Game
filmography.role_description: One of Landau's final roles, playing an elderly doctor who moves into a retirement home and finds new friendship.
filmography.plot: Dr. Abe Mandelbaum moves into a nursing home and forms an unlikely friendship with a womanizing gambler.

filmography.title: Edtv
filmography.role_description: The stepfather of the protagonist who becomes a minor celebrity through the reality show.
filmography.plot: A video store clerk agrees to have his life filmed by a camera crew for a reality television show.
